description: The conversation shows how PodMatch AI matches a startup‑exit expert to the "Founder Roadmap" podcast, ranks candidates using episode topics and audience interests, and then drafts a concise outreach email.

messages.content: You are PodMatch AI, an agentic assistant that helps podcast hosts find ideal guests by analysing podcast metadata, audience analytics, searching expert databases, ranking candidates, and generating personalized outreach emails.

I need a guest who has experience in successful startup exits for my upcoming episode on scaling and exit strategies. My podcast is "Founder Roadmap" and the RSS feed is https://example.com/feed.xml. Here is my audience analytics CSV:
"category,percentage
Product Development,30
Startup Funding,25
Growth Hacking,20
Exit Strategies,15
Community Building,10"
Let me pull the latest episode data from your RSS feed so I can see which topics you’ve already covered.

{"episodes":[{"title":"From Idea to IPO: The Journey of TechStart","description":"Founders discuss product‑market fit and fundraising.","guest":"Emily Chen","topics":["Product Development","Startup Funding"]},{"title":"Growth Hacks That Actually Work","description":"Scaling tactics for early‑stage SaaS.","guest":"Michael Patel","topics":["Growth Hacking","Customer Acquisition"]},{"title":"Navigating the Exit Landscape","description":"Legal and financial steps for a successful exit.","guest":"Laura Gomez","topics":["Exit Strategies","M&A"]}]}
Great, I have the episode topics. Next, I’ll analyze your audience analytics to surface the top interest categories.

arguments.analytics_data:
category,percentage
Product Development,30
Startup Funding,25
Growth Hacking,20
Exit Strategies,15
Community Building,10

messages.content: Based on your past episodes and audience interests, I’ll search for experts who have successfully exited startups.

{"candidates":[{"name":"Jane Doe","affiliation":"Acme Corp (ex‑CEO)","bio":"Led Acme from seed to acquisition by XYZ for $120M.","email":"jane.doe@acme.com","recent_work":"https://acme.com/blog/jane-exit"},{"name":"John Smith","affiliation":"Beta Ventures","bio":"Serial founder; sold BetaSoft to MegaTech for $80M.","email":"john.smith@betaventures.com","recent_work":"https://betaventures.com/john"},{"name":"Aisha Khan","affiliation":"Khan Innovations","bio":"Co‑founder of a health‑tech startup acquired by HealthPlus.","email":"aisha.khan@khaninnov.com","recent_work":"https://khaninnov.com/exit"},{"name":"Luis Martinez","affiliation":"ScaleUp Labs","bio":"Guided ScaleUp from launch to $200M acquisition.","email":"luis.martinez@scalelabs.com","recent_work":"https://scalelabs.com/luis"},{"name":"Priya Patel","affiliation":"EcoShift","bio":"EcoShift sold to GreenWorld for $50M after rapid scaling.","email":"priya.patel@ecoshift.com","recent_work":"https://ecoshift.com/priya"}]}
Now I’ll rank these candidates against your episode topics and audience interests.

arguments.guest_bio: Led Acme from seed to acquisition by XYZ for $120M.
arguments.episode_theme: Scaling & Exit Strategies: Lessons from Successful Founders

messages.content:
Subject: Invitation to Join "Founder Roadmap" – Talk About Your Exit Journey

Hi Jane,

I’m Alex Rivera, host of the "Founder Roadmap" podcast where we dive deep into the stories behind high‑growth startups and the pivotal moments that shape them. Our listeners – ambitious founders and aspiring entrepreneurs – are especially keen on learning how to scale efficiently and execute successful exits.

Given your impressive track record leading Acme from its early days to a $120M acquisition by XYZ, I believe your insights would resonate strongly with our audience. I’d love to have you on an upcoming episode titled "Scaling & Exit Strategies: Lessons from Successful Founders" to discuss:
- The key milestones that prepared Acme for acquisition
- Strategic decisions that maximized valuation
- Advice for founders aiming for a smooth exit

We typically record remotely at a time convenient for you and the episode runs about 45 minutes. Please let me know if you’re interested and a few windows that work for you, and I’ll take care of the rest.

Thank you for considering the invitation – I’m excited about the possibility of sharing your story with our community.

Best regards,
Alex Rivera
Host, Founder Roadmap
alex@founderroadmap.com

Here’s the draft email you can send to Jane Doe. Feel free to tweak any details before sending:

---
Subject: Invitation to Join "Founder Roadmap" – Talk About Your Exit Journey

Hi Jane,

I’m Alex Rivera, host of the "Founder Roadmap" podcast where we dive deep into the stories behind high‑growth startups and the pivotal moments that shape them. Our listeners – ambitious founders and aspiring entrepreneurs – are especially keen on learning how to scale efficiently and execute successful exits.

Given your impressive track record leading Acme from its early days to a $120M acquisition by XYZ, I believe your insights would resonate strongly with our audience. I’d love to have you on an upcoming episode titled "Scaling & Exit Strategies: Lessons from Successful Founders" to discuss:
- The key milestones that prepared Acme for acquisition
- Strategic decisions that maximized valuation
- Advice for founders aiming for a smooth exit

We typically record remotely at a time convenient for you and the episode runs about 45 minutes. Please let me know if you’re interested and a few windows that work for you, and I’ll take care of the rest.

Thank you for considering the invitation – I’m excited about the possibility of sharing your story with our community.

Best regards,
Alex Rivera
Host, Founder Roadmap
alex@founderroadmap.com
---
Let me know if you’d like any changes or if you’d like me to schedule a time slot for the recording.
